Sentencas: Developing oxygen electrodes with improved polarization is a major concern for improving the commercial viability of solid oxide electrolyzers (SOECs).
Titulo: Electrochemical characteristics of Sr-deficient SrTi0.3Fe0.7O3-δ oxygen electrodes for solid oxide electrolyzers

Sentencas: SrTi0.3Fe0.7O3-delta (STF) has recently emerged as a catalytically active and highly stable oxygen electrode, and its performance has been shown to improve when it is deficient in Sr.
Titulo: Electrochemical characteristics of Sr-deficient SrTi0.3Fe0.7O3-δ oxygen electrodes for solid oxide electrolyzers

Sentencas: However, the mechanism by which Sr deficiency alters the STF polarization behavior still remains to be clarified.
Titulo: Electrochemical characteristics of Sr-deficient SrTi0.3Fe0.7O3-δ oxygen electrodes for solid oxide electrolyzers

Sentencas: In this study, we explored the electrochemical characteristics of Sr1-xTi0.3Fe0.7O3-delta (STFx; x = 0.03 and 0.06) to elucidate the effect of Sr deficiency on electrode polarization.
Titulo: Electrochemical characteristics of Sr-deficient SrTi0.3Fe0.7O3-δ oxygen electrodes for solid oxide electrolyzers

Sentencas: The results showed that Sr deficiency effectively improves the electrode/electrolyte interfacial resistance and oxygen-transport kinetics.
Titulo: Electrochemical characteristics of Sr-deficient SrTi0.3Fe0.7O3-δ oxygen electrodes for solid oxide electrolyzers

Sentencas: However, the latter effect was observed to be rather diminished by the degraded mi-crostructure, possibly owing to enhanced sinterability of the Sr-deficient compositions.
Titulo: Electrochemical characteristics of Sr-deficient SrTi0.3Fe0.7O3-δ oxygen electrodes for solid oxide electrolyzers

Sentencas: Symmetric cell life tests conducted over similar to 1110 h revealed that STFx maintains low polarization to prevent electrode delami-nation.
Titulo: Electrochemical characteristics of Sr-deficient SrTi0.3Fe0.7O3-δ oxygen electrodes for solid oxide electrolyzers

Sentencas: The Ni-YSZ supported cell with the STF0.06 electrode exhibits improved steam electrolysis per-formance, yielding a high current density of similar to 2.71 A cm-2 at 750 degrees C and 1.3 V.(c) 2023
Titulo: Electrochemical characteristics of Sr-deficient SrTi0.3Fe0.7O3-δ oxygen electrodes for solid oxide electrolyzers
